visualization_explanation: The dataset represents a simplified one-dimensional model of atmospheric stratification using equal segment proportions. While real atmospheric layers exhibit exponential density decay (barometric formula), the synthetic data employs uniform segmentation (μ=16.67% per layer, σ=0) to emphasize structural hierarchy over physical proportions. Data quality reflects educational simplification of NASA's atmospheric physics models. The stacked percentage column chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating axes and gridlines, focusing attention on relative layer positions. Cairo's principles of salience are implemented through: 1) Color progression from warm (surface) to cool (space) hues 2) Direct height annotation within columns 3) Interactive tooltip augmentation. The uniform segmentation creates artificial clusters while maintaining accurate ordinal relationships between layers.
